name: Abereiddy (Blue Lagoon)
description: Famous Blue Lagoon quarry plus dramatic coastline. Perfect for first-timers with progression to bigger jumps. Sheltered lagoon for nervous starters.

name: St Davids Peninsula
description: TYF's home turf - they invented coasteering here in 1986. Multiple sites depending on conditions. Seals, caves, and world-class coastline.

name: Stackpole
description: National Trust coastline near Barafundle Bay. Sheltered sites perfect for families and beginners. Stunning scenery and usually calm waters.

name: Abermawr
description: Wild north Pembrokeshire coastline. Preseli Venture's local patch. More adventurous than south coast sites. Remote and atmospheric.

name: Porth Clais
description: Historic harbour with sheltered coasteering. Good beginner spot with easy access. Boat traffic in summer - stay aware.

name: Barry Island
description: South Wales coasteering with easy access. Good for beginners and groups. Near Cardiff so popular for stag/hen parties.

name: Gower Coastline
description: Various sites along Gower depending on conditions. More exposed than Pembrokeshire. Spectacular when conditions allow.

name: Anglesey Coast
description: North Wales coasteering with dramatic scenery. Colder water than south. South Stack area particularly good. Seal encounters common.

name: Ll≈∑n Peninsula
description: Less developed than Pembrokeshire but equally stunning. Quieter spots for those wanting solitude. Advance booking essential.
